intro: Eriocnema × sanderae, commonly known as the sanderae hybrid, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. The hybrid nature of Eriocnema × sanderae suggests it results from crossbreeding between species within the genus Eriocnema.
